title.value: Synthesis of purine 3-alpha-fluoronucleosides with application of Thermus thermophilus pyrimidine nucleoside phosphorylase and Escherichia coli purine nucleoside phosphorylase
Синтез пуриновых 3-альфа –фторнуклеозидов с использованием пиримидиннуклеозидфосфорилазы Thermus thermophilus и пиримидиннуклеозидфосфорилазы Escherichia coli

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Kvach, S.V., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Institute of Microbiology

abstract.value: Development of genetic engineering allows creation of recombinant strains of microorganisms, supplying super-production of essential enzymes - nucleoside phosphorylases, used for enzymatic development of nucleosides. A method for increasing of the efficiency of synthesis of escherichia coli cells of Thermus thermophilus pyrimidine nucleoside phosphorilase (PyrNPase) by inserting silent mutations in the gene encoding PyrNPase and by raising the temperature of the enzyme synthesis induction by bacterial cells to 42 Celsius degree has been described in the article. The ability of mutant PyrNPase to catalyze the phosphorolysis of 3'-fluoro-3'-deoxyuridine and 3'-fluoro-2',3'-deoxythymidine has been shown. For the first time recombinant nucleoside phosphorylases are used for the enzymatic synthesis of 3'-fluoro-3'-deoxyadenosine, 3'-fluoro-3'-deoxy-2-aminpdenosine, 3'-fluoro-3'-deoxyguanosine, 3'-fluoro-2',3'-dideoxy-2-fluoroadenosine, 3'-fluoro-2',3'-dideoxy-2-chloradenosine and 3'-fluoro-3'-deoxy-2-fluoroadenisine.
